Mrs. S. M. I. Henry and the W. C. T. U. 


     [MRS. S. M. I. HENRY, HERE REFERRED TO, WAS THE NATIONAL EVANGELIST FOR THE WOMEN'S CHRISTIAN TEMPERANCE UNION. THE PHYSICIANS AT THE BATTLE CREEK SANITARIUM WHERE SHE HAD GONE IN 1896, AS A PATIENT, HELD OUT NO HOPE FOR HER RELEASE FROM A WHEEL CHAIR DURING HER LIFETIME. HOWEVER, IN ANSWER TO THE PRAYER OF FAITH, SHE WAS REMARKABLY RESTORED, AFTER SHE HAD COVENANTED TO KEEP ALL OF GOD'S COMMANDMENTS. HER FULL ACCEPTANCE OF THE FAITH OF SEVENTH-DAY ADVENTISTS BROUGHT GREAT JOY TO THE HEART OF MRS. WHITE, WHO WAS IN AUSTRALIA AT THE TIME. THROUGH CORRESPONDENCE A WARM PERSONAL FRIENDSHIP WAS CREATED BETWEEN THESE TWO GODLY WOMEN. IN DECEMBER, 1898, MRS. WHITE WROTE AS FOLLOWS REGARDING THE RELATION OF MRS. HENRY TO THE W. C. T. U.]:
